summary: This is an FBI operational request seeking authority to use an undercover employee to investigate Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, who attempted to sell documents related to a civil lawsuit against Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000. The document outlines a planned sting operation to catch Rodriguez in the act of selling the subpoenaed documents.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein attempting to sell documents
persons.context: He is the subject of the FBI investigation for attempting to sell documents subpoenaed in a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.role: Attorney representing plaintiffs suing Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He was contacted by Alfredo Rodriguez, who tried to sell him documents related to his civil case against Epstein. Edwards refused due to ethical obligations and reported the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the defendant in the civil lawsuit for which the documents were subpoenaed. His former employee, Rodriguez, attempted to sell these documents.

connections.description: Rodriguez was an employee for Epstein, as stated in the document.
Rodriguez contacted Edwards, who had deposed him and served him with a subpoena, to illegally sell him documents related to Edwards' case against Epstein.
Edwards is an attorney representing four female individuals who are suing Jeffrey Epstein in a civil case.

events.title: Rodriguez contacts Edwards to sell documents
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez contacted attorney Bradley Edwards and attempted to sell him documents subpoenaed in the civil case against Jeffrey Epstein for $50,000.

events.title: FBI requests undercover operation authority
events.description: The FBI drafted a request for SAC authority to utilize an undercover employee to conduct a sting operation against Alfredo Rodriguez for attempting to sell the subpoenaed documents.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, attempted to sell documents subpoenaed in a civil lawsuit against Epstein to plaintiff's attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000 in August 2009.
Attorney Bradley Edwards refused the illegal offer, citing ethical obligations, and the incident was reported to law enforcement.
The FBI sought authority on November 5, 2009, to conduct an undercover sting operation, using an undercover employee to pose as a buyer to catch Rodriguez in the act of selling the documents.
The planned operation involved a face-to-face meeting in an FBI-controlled hotel room to complete the transaction and gather evidence.
The document reveals internal obstruction of justice by an Epstein associate attempting to profit from evidence in a civil case against him.
